authorAffiliation.value: SUNY College of Environmental Science and Forestry
SUNY College of Environmental Science and Forestry

dsDescriptionValue.value: RZ-TRADEOFF Water and Air Quality Model is a riparian zone model aiming to predict key riparian functions (NO<sub>3</sub>- and phosphate [PO<sub>4</sub><sup>3-</sup>] concentration and removal in subsurface flow, total phosphorus [TP] removal in overland flow, nitrous oxide [N<sub>2</sub>O], methane [CH<sub>4</sub>], and carbon dioxide [CO<sub>2</sub>] emissions, water table) based on landscape hydrogeomorphic characteristics, weather, and land cover/land use. USDA-NIFA Award # 2015-67019-23586.

publicationCitation.value: Hassanzadeh Y., Vidon P., Gold A.J., Pradhannang SM, Addy K. RZ-TRADEOFF: A New Model to Estimate Riparian Water and Air Quality Functions. Journal of Environmental Quality (in review)

files.description: Example 1 shows multiple sites for one date.
files.label: RZ TRADEOFF EXAMPLE 1.xlsx

dataFile.description: Example 1 shows multiple sites for one date.

files.description: Example 2 shows data for one site over multiple dates.
files.label: RZ TRADEOFF EXAMPLE 2.xlsx

dataFile.description: Example 2 shows data for one site over multiple dates.

files.description: There are three files included in RZ-TRADE OFF. The RZ TRADEOFF 012418 file is the most current version of the model ready for use. The purpose of this model is to estimate key riparian functions based on publicly available soil, weather, and geology data. It is set to calculate up to 20 years of data. Detailed descriptions and instruction on how to enter data and use the model are provided within the file. Links to websites where the necessary weather, soil, and geology data can be accessed are also provided.
files.label: RZ TRADEOFF READ ME.docx
